page.title: 04Village of Wickhamford - two
page.content: There are several shops including the Post Office. The Old Age Pensioners do their major shopping in Wickhamford, but others travel to Evesham or Cheltenham. The A44 road is very busy, with heavy traffic. There are fruit stalls along Pitchers Hill, especially in summer. The local pub is called the Sandys Arms. The village has a playing field which is used for football and there is a sports club. The field has a slide and climbing frame. The parish council has 7 members. Some of them attend meetings of The Playing Fields Association and the Parish Councils Association, where they can gain advice, and sometimes grants. They deal with litter, vandalism and look after the cemetary in Golden Lane. Recently they allocated a grant towards the Scout Hut in Badsey.
